To: Network Acceptance Subcommittee Subject: "The Aging in Europe11
From: Jim Slack, KUSD
Dr, Donahue has, I believe, produced quite a useful series.
Gerontology has become increasingly important as a field
of study. European ideas and attitudes on a subject of such
world wide concern, should interest many people. I certainly
hope that the level on all the interviews is high and clear
enough so that what these aging Europeans with their various
accents, can be understood. Further, I hope that each of the
famous old people interviewed in the various countries do not
say substantially the same thing. Nonetheless, I found the
audition tape very much worthwhile and approve solidly of the
idea and the manner in which it was handled. Yes.
Sincerely,
A Jim Slack
/ / Network Acceptance Committee
JS/eg
